etymology.description: semantic 女(女) (nǚ, 'woman') + phonetic 乃(乃) (nǎi, 'so') = related to women, sound similar to 乃 -> 'milk'
etymology.interpretation: 奶(nǎi) combines the semantic component 女(女) (nǚ, 'woman') to indicate a connection with women, specifically relating to breastfeeding, and 乃(乃) (nǎi, 'so') as a phonetic component. This structure makes intuitive sense as it suggests a term linked to women, utilizing a sound similar to the word for nurturing.

examples.chinese: 妈妈给宝宝喝奶(媽媽給寶寶喝奶)。
牛奶可以帮助人体吸收营养(牛奶可以幫助人體吸收營養)，尤其是儿童(尤其是兒童)。
examples.pinyin: Niúnǎi kěyǐ bāngzhù réntǐ xīshōu yíngyǎng, yóuqí shì értóng.
examples.english: Milk can help the body absorb nutrients, especially for children.

examples.chinese: 他在超市买了一瓶奶(他在超市買了一瓶奶)，打算明天做甜点(打算明天做甜點)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài chāoshì mǎile yī píng nǎi, dǎsuàn míngtiān zuò tiándiǎn.
examples.english: He bought a bottle of milk at the supermarket and plans to make dessert tomorrow.
